$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

strong.span: Governor Wolf has ordered all school buildings and facilities to remain closed through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. We are working diligently to collect additional information on many of the questions you and we have. We will share what we know as soon as we know it. We appreciate and thank you for your patience during this evolving situation!

p.span: ALL school buildings and facilities are CLOSED – which in turn includes ALL playgrounds/tennis courts/basketball courts/etc.

p.strong: ONLY those personnel who have been deemed essential (and have been notified as such) have access to our buildings and facilities at this time. Our ENTIRE team – including our full team of teachers - is working remotely with access to their classroom voicemail, BASD emails, computers, etc. Additionally, we apologize, but they do NOT have access to their own or student personal items left behind at BASD buildings or facilities.
This statement does not impact our Grab and Go Lunch Program.
We appreciate your cooperation and understanding!

strong.em: If a family has school-aged children they are getting meals for, they can also receive a meal for other children that are 18 years or younger.

p.span: BASH students who signed up for AP Exams will be receiving an email survey this week and the results will be shared with BASH afterward. Please encourage your students to complete the survey because it asks them to identify their AP plans. This information is important to us as we prepare for online exam implementation.
BASH students will receive the email to the email address they used when signing up for AP Exams.
We are also excited to announce a parent webinar available on April 16 at 7:00 p.m. with pertinent information for parents regarding AP online testing.
Register here: AP Parent Meeting Registration for the April 16 parent webinar about the online AP exams

Out of an abundance of caution, BASD will be conducting the April 17, 2020, Finance, Facilities & Operations Committee meeting (reconvened) using Zoom. Citizens wishing to participate or listen to the meetings may call in or log-in via their computer device using the following telephone numbers, Meeting ID, and weblink (if participating via computer).
Finance, Facilities and Operations Committee Meeting will reconvene on Friday, April 17 at 5:45 PM
Please click the link below to join the webinar:

span.p: When: Apr 17, 2020 05:45 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)
Topic: Finance, Facilities, Operations Committee Meeting
Please click the link below to join the webinar:

span.span: Dial (for higher quality, dial a number

p.span: The following are instructions for using Zoom:

strong.span: Due to the health crisis, we are currently working with the Boyertown Area School District and our licensing company, MTI, to reschedule the upcoming performances. At this time, all sales have been suspended. Within the next two weeks, we will have a clearer picture of when it’s safe to return to school. We will send out an email and post updates on the webpage with our plan for new show dates, times, and ticket redistribution as soon as we know when we are heading back to school. We are still looking forward to sharing this spectacular show with the Boyertown community in the upcoming month. We appreciate your understanding and support!

p.a: Did You Know? Video 2: Reasons and Data

p.em: In a first of its kind series for BASD, we would like to educate our learning community at large, about outside cyber and charter schools, their impact on our district, and our plans to bring our students home.

What is the difference between a cyber school and a charter school? Are they truly “free”? How many students from our district attend outside cyber/charter schools? Why do families choose these options? How do the PA cyber and charter schools perform as compared to BASD? Are these schools subject to the same rules and regulations that public schools must adhere to? And more…

At this point, you may be asking yourself, “Why do I care?” Quite simply, because as a taxpayer, you are funding more than $2.0M per year in BASD costs associated with these outside placements. We’re guessing that we have your attention now!

Over the coming weeks, we will be sharing short videos via FB, Twitter (via a link), and our website aimed at educating our district community on all of this and more. We will also introduce you to Berks Online Learning – our own cyber school offering. Finally, we will talk to you about the efforts underway to bring our students back to the Boyertown Learning Community – whether via our brick and mortar buildings or our own, much more cost-effective, cyber opportunity. Stay tuned…we’re never too old to learn!!

span.p: 2020-2021 Kindergarten Registration is underway! If you received our mailing containing the registration instructions, please visit our Registration Page for more details and to register.

If you did NOT receive our mailing with the instructions and you have NOT completed the on-line registration process, please email BASD Registration and provide your name, your child's name, your child's date of birth, your address, and your telephone number, and we will mail a packet to you directly.
We are excited to meet our newest BEARS!
Here is a link to the most up-to-date version of the Approved BASD Catchments by school building for all students in grades K – 8 for the 2020-2021 School Year.

p.br: Catchments are color-coded by school. Schools are grouped by elementary and middle school categories. You can show the areas for both middle schools and elementary schools at the same time or choose to look at just one of the categories by checking and unchecking boxes. You can type in your specific address and confirm your school assignment for each child by clicking on the magnifying glass.

span.p: Please note that the school assignment is based upon the child’s primary residence as listed in Infinite Campus and documented via proofs of residency and any appropriate legal documents.
If after using the map, you still have questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at BASDregistration@boyertownasd.org.

p.br: DISCLAIMER: This map was drawn for BASD using Google Maps. BASD cannot guarantee the accuracy of the Google Maps tool. Final school assignments are at the discretion of BASD based upon the Board Approved Scenario 2 Rightsizing Project. As of the 2020-2021 school year, BASD no longer has “gray areas”, nor do we accept deviation requests.

br.span: Boyertown Area School District has embarked on a journey to create our Profile of a Graduate. Our Profile will serve as a guiding light as we address the necessities of 21st Century learning while engaging our students, educational team, and community stakeholders as ONE BOYERTOWN learning community. Click here to learn more.

span.p:
Want to stay connected to what is happening with our School Board? We’d love that! By clicking on the link below you can access meeting dates and times, agendas, meeting minutes; and view videos of past meetings dating back to January 2019. Check it out!
https://go.boarddocs.com/pa/boyr/Board.nsf/Public
For information regarding meetings from prior years, please visit https://www.boyertownasd.org/domain/61.

a.title: Go to comments for Safety and Security Grant Awarded

div.p: Throughout the school year, either via direct communication or school board budget meetings, we have attempted to keep our internal and external constituents informed about the current state of our finances.

a.title: Go to comments for Financial State of the District

img.alt: BASD Demographics, Enrollment Projections, and Building Utilization Scenarios

a.span: BASD Demographics, Enrollment Projections, and Building Utilization Scenarios

a.title: Go to comments for BASD Demographics, Enrollment Projections, and Building Utilization Scenarios

img.alt: SAFE 2 SAY SOMETHING ANONYMOUS REPORTING SYSTEM

a.span: SAFE 2 SAY SOMETHING ANONYMOUS REPORTING SYSTEM

div.p: Boyertown Announces the launch of the Safe 2 Say Something anonymous reporting system. A program which teaches students, teachers and administrators how to recognize warning signs and signals, especially within social media, of individuals who may be a threat to themselves or others and SAY Something to a trusted adult OR use its anonymous reporting system.

a.title: Go to comments for SAFE 2 SAY SOMETHING ANONYMOUS REPORTING SYSTEM

img.alt: Boyertown Area School District Selects Infinite Campus

a.span: Boyertown Area School District Selects Infinite Campus

div.p: Infinite Campus was selected by the Boyertown Area School District as its new student information system (SIS) to reduce third-party systems, better functionality, more efficient and effective service for our staff, parents, students, and community.

a.title: Go to comments for Boyertown Area School District Selects Infinite Campus

div.p: The 2019-2020 BASD Student Calendar was approved at the Board Meeting on January 8, 2019.

a.title: Go to comments for 2019-2020 BASD Student Calendar

div.p: Hello BASD: I am writing to share some information regarding a significant change related to school safety in BASD. Most importantly, I want to share that our efforts are moving forward not only with regards to school safety but also wellness.

a.title: Go to comments for School Safety: A Shared Responsibility

img.alt: Lead Levels in the Drinking Water

a.span: Lead Levels in the Drinking Water

div.p: Per PA Public School Code Section 742, beginning with the 2018-2019 school year, and every year thereafter, BASD will start testing for lead levels in the drinking water of all school buildings.

a.title: Go to comments for Lead Levels in the Drinking Water

div.p: **NEW** The BASD Electronic Community Bulletin Board is simply a bulletin board hosted on the district website for our community to receive information. Here you will find flyers for upcoming events, and many other announcements!! Come and see what is happening!

a.title: Go to comments for BASD Electronic Community Bulletin Board

div.p: The Pennsylvania Department of Health has issued new immunization requirements effective August 1, 2017 for the 2017-2018 School Year. Therefore, on the first day of school, your child must have all completed immunizations or a medical plan indicating the completion of the immunization series within the first five days of school or risk exclusion. Please note those immunizations that need only one dose must be completed by the first day of school.

a.title: Go to comments for SCHOOL VACCINATION REQUIREMENTS

img.alt: Statement Regarding the Federal Court Ruling in Joel Doe V. BASD

a.span: Statement Regarding the Federal Court Ruling in Joel Doe V. BASD

div.p: The Boyertown Area School District (BASD), which deeply respects and is sensitive to the privacy rights of all students, is gratified with the Third Circuit Court of Appeals

a.title: Go to comments for Statement Regarding the Federal Court Ruling in Joel Doe V. BASD

img.alt: Update - Boyertown Area Senior High Memorial Stadium

a.span: Update - Boyertown Area Senior High Memorial Stadium

div.p: Boyertown Area Senior High (BASH) Memorial Stadium grandstand (home bleachers) have recently been closed due to a structural study being performed, assessing its structural integrity.

a.title: Go to comments for Update - Boyertown Area Senior High Memorial Stadium
